title: Key points of trademark management of Academia Sinica
question: I want to apply for trademark commercial authorization, what relevant documents and plans do I need to prepare?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer:
The documents and plans you need to prepare include the following:

The first is your identification document. If you are a natural person (that is, an individual), what you need to prepare is a photocopy of your national identity card, or a photocopy of your nationality certificate or passport. If you are a legal entity, you need an up-to-date and valid certification of establishment. If you are an organization other than a legal person, you must submit a copy of the document proving legal registration or establishment.

The next thing you need to prepare is a plan. This plan must include a brief introduction to your business and your performance. Then there is the purpose, scope, and region of trademark application. What you also need to explain is the product application, design concept, design drawings and color physical drawings. At the same time, you must also prepare a usage plan, which includes a marketing plan, publicity methods, your estimated turnover and sales channels. The period or number of times of application, as well as the conditions for authorization fees, royalties or feedback payments must also be clearly stated.

Finally, if the Intellectual Property Office requires you to provide other documents again, you must remember to submit them.

title: Key points of plant variety rights protection and management work of Academia Sinica
question: What kind of rights does "plant variety rights" refer to?

Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Plant variety rights refer to the right to register a variety right upon approval by the competent authority if a variety possesses novelty, distinguishability, consistency, stability and an appropriate variety name according to the provisions of the Plant Variety and Seedling Law.

title: Key points of plant variety rights protection and management work of Academia Sinica
question: The "gene transfer" mentioned here, what technologies does it include?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Gene transfer involves technologies such as genetic engineering or molecular biology. These technologies can allow foreign genes to be transferred into plant cells to form genetic recombination, allowing plants to exhibit the characteristics of foreign genes. However, gene transfer does not include traditional techniques such as hybridization, mutagenesis, in vitro fertilization, fusion of subfamily cells and protoplasts, somatic mutation, and chromosome doubling.

title: Key points of plant variety rights protection and management work of Academia Sinica
question: What does "transgenic plant" mean? What plants does it contain?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: "Genetically modified plants" refers to plants produced through genetically modified technology, including plants, seeds, and their offspring obtained through this technology. Gene transfer technology involves the use of genetic engineering or molecular biology technology to transfer foreign genes into plant cells, allowing these plants to exhibit the characteristics of the foreign genes. However, traditional techniques such as hybridization, mutagenesis, in vitro fertilization, fusion of cells and protoplasts below plant taxonomic families, somatic mutation, and chromosome doubling are not considered gene transfer.

First of all, if you want to apply for plant variety rights, you must apply to Academia Sinica and submit the Academia Sinica’s R&D Results Disclosure Form, application form, plant variety instructions from the Council of Agriculture, and relevant supporting documents.

Then, Academia Sinica’s Intellectual Property Office will process your application. title: Key points of patent application and maintenance work of Academia Sinica
question: What will the Intellectual Property Office do after filing a patent application?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: After you submit a patent application, the Intellectual Property Office will first have the person in charge enter the application information into the intellectual property database and check whether your information is complete. If the information is incomplete, the person in charge will notify you to submit it. Then, based on the principle of applying for a U.S. provisional patent, the person in charge will first conduct a patent search and market survey after approval by the Director of the Intellectual Property Office, and recommend or not recommend a patent application. If you apply for a provisional case and claim priority to apply for a patent in my country or other countries, the organizer will conduct an evaluation by a patent evaluator. If you do not apply for a provisional case but directly apply for a patent in my country or other countries, the organizer will also conduct the same patent search, market survey and patent evaluation work, and then based on the above work results, recommend whether to apply for a patent.

This evaluation process must be done within The provisional case shall be completed within eleven months from the date of application. Then secondly, the organizer must make a recommendation or not recommend applying for a patent, and fill in this recommendation on the cutting form. Only after the above things are completed and approved by the Director of the Intellectual Property Office can the next application cycle proceed.

title: Key points of patent application and maintenance work of Academia Sinica
question: What are the key points of patent application and maintenance work at Academia Sinica?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer:
The main process of patent application and maintenance work of Academia Sinica is roughly as follows:

The first is the preliminary review. First discuss it with the creator or his representative and his unit, and respond within one month after getting their opinions. It then takes another seven working days to complete the initial evaluation.

Then there is the re-evaluation, which means that the director of the Intellectual Property Division will complete the re-evaluation in seven working days based on the results of the initial evaluation. Once the results are available, the creator or his representative will be notified.

If you decide to continue maintenance, just do it. If maintenance is no longer required, an announcement will be made on the website of the Intellectual Property Office to let everyone know. This announcement period is three months.

After the announcement period, the matter of whether to give up or give up maintenance will be discussed by the research and management meeting.

In addition, if Academia Sinica is the patentee but other units share the patent fees, it will decide not to continue maintenance after the initial evaluation and re-evaluation, and will notify other units of the matter first. If they are willing to take over, they can go directly to the Research and Management Committee for review without making an announcement.

Finally, if Academia Sinica and other units jointly own the patent rights, then operate according to the contract or agreement. If it is not specified how to do it, ask other units in writing whether they want to continue maintenance. Then follow the initial evaluation and re-evaluation procedures mentioned above. If maintenance is not continued, it will be directly submitted to the Research and Management Committee for review.

If other units are academic research institutions or governments, then decide not to continue maintenance after the initial evaluation and re-evaluation, and make an announcement with their written consent, and then go to the Research and Management Committee to discuss how to handle it.

If when Academia Sinica announces the transfer of patent rights, other units are willing to take over, and follow-up procedures will be handled in accordance with relevant regulations of Academia Sinica.

title: Key points of patent application and maintenance work of Academia Sinica
question: In Academia Sinica's patent maintenance evaluation process, what does the initial evaluation mean?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: In the patent maintenance evaluation process of Academia Sinica, the initial evaluation is mainly for the Intellectual Property Office to first find the creators or people who represent them, and the departments where they work to ask for their opinions. Their comments must be responded to within one month. The organizer must complete this preliminary evaluation within seven working days after receiving the opinions.

title: Key points of patent application and maintenance work of Academia Sinica
question: If after the initial evaluation, the Director of the Intellectual Property Division wants to conduct a re-evaluation, how long does this process usually take?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The process of re-evaluation by the Director of the Intellectual Property Division after the initial evaluation usually takes seven working days to complete.

title: Key points of patent application and maintenance work of Academia Sinica
question: If after re-evaluation, it is decided not to continue to maintain the patent, what is usually the next step?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If it is decided not to maintain the patent after re-evaluation, the next step is to announce the transfer on the Intellectual Property Division's website, and the announcement period will last for three months. After the announcement transfer period ends, the research and management committee will be asked to consider whether to transfer or give up maintenance.

title: Key points of patent application and maintenance work of Academia Sinica
question: When Academia Sinica shares patent rights with units outside the academy, how should it be handled?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer:
When Academia Sinica holds patent rights together with other entities, there are several steps to be aware of. The first is to operate according to the contract or agreement. If it is not written in the contract, then ask other units in writing whether they are willing to continue to maintain the patent. After receiving their answers, the Intellectual Property Office will first conduct a preliminary evaluation and re-evaluation process. If the re-evaluation result is that it is decided to continue maintenance, then it will be done. However, if they choose not to maintain it, the case will be directly handed over to the Research and Management Committee for discussion. .

If the external unit that shares the patent rights with Academia Sinica is an academic research institution or a government department and happens to decide not to maintain the patent, then the Intellectual Property Office will first complete the preliminary evaluation and re-evaluation, and then obtain their written consent and announce the transfer online. patent. After the announcement is over, we still have to rely on the research and management meeting to discuss how to deal with it.

title: Key points of patent application and maintenance work of Academia Sinica
question: If Academia Sinica is the patentee alone, but there are units outside the institute willing to share the patent fees, how will the procedures for maintaining the patent be different?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If Academia Sinica is the patentee and there are units outside the institute willing to share the patent fees, the procedures for maintaining the patent will be a little different. First, a preliminary evaluation and a re-evaluation will be conducted. If it is decided not to continue to maintain the patent, it will be notified to the outside unit before the transfer is announced. If that unit says they are willing to take over the patent, there is no need to go through the announcement transfer process, but directly ask the Research and Management Committee to review the matter.

Such an announcement period usually lasts three months.

ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw

This research management committee will evaluate whether to transfer the patent or give up maintenance. Therefore, the decision to transfer the patent or give up maintenance is decided by the Research and Management Committee.

title: Key points of patent application and maintenance work of Academia Sinica
question: What should we do if Academia Sinica’s patent rights are infringed?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If Academia Sinica’s patent rights are infringed, we must immediately investigate the facts and make an assessment as soon as we find out. After confirming the evidence, you can then decide whether to seek legal assistance based on the situation. You may also need to conduct a patent infringement appraisal. If any compensation, settlement or related money is received due to this patent dispute, it will be retained in the Scientific Research Fund of Academia Sinica, and will be handled in accordance with the management and use of the fund.

Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if Academia Sinica has doubts that a patent right has been infringed or may be infringed, they will immediately conduct a fact investigation and assessment. If clear evidence confirms infringement, Academia Sinica will evaluate whether it is necessary to propose legal remedies. They may also propose a patent infringement appraisal based on the circumstances.

contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The technical pricing review of Academia Sinica's price creation plan is carried out by two members of the Research and Management Committee appointed by the convener of the Research and Management Committee. They will consider some factors during the review process, such as whether the core technology is original, what the market analysis and commercialization plan are, what the business model and expected benefits will be, the maturity of the product, technology and operating model, and How professional and complete is the executive team?

title: Academia Sinica’s precautions when handling price creation planning technology pricing
question: What are the factors included in the technical price review of the price creation plan?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The factors for reviewing technical pricing conditions include five parts. The first is the originality of the core technology, that is, whether the technology is novel. The second is market analysis and commercialization planning, focusing on the potential of this technology in the market. The third factor is the business model and expected benefits, analyzing whether the technology can bring commercial success. Fourth, the maturity of the product, technology and operating model must be sufficient, indicating that the technology has proven its value in actual use or production. Finally, the professionalism and integrity of the executive team are also important. A strong and professional team can effectively promote the development of technology.

title: The Intellectual Property Division of Academia Sinica handles technical transfer cases when the original creator’s representative no longer works at Academia Sinica.
question: What should we do if the creative representative who was originally responsible for technical transfer no longer works at Academia Sinica?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer:
If the creative representative responsible for technical transfer no longer works at Academia Sinica, there are several situations. If the original creator representative has left Academia Sinica, such as resigning, retiring or passing away, we will select a new representative based on the order of authorized creator representatives in the original technical disclosure document, or the original creator representative can be designated to serve at Academia Sinica Other creators serve as representatives of the new creator. Of course, this requires signing a licensing agreement.

If all the creators no longer work at Academia Sinica, the original creator representative can designate the most suitable on-the-job researcher at Academia Sinica to serve as the new creator representative for the technology transfer project, which also requires signing an authorization agreement.

If the original creator's representative and other creators cannot be contacted, then the institute or center (director or director) related to the technology transfer project can designate the most suitable in-service researcher from Academia Sinica to serve as the creator representative of the technology transfer project, which still requires a signed authorization Agreement.

title: The Intellectual Property Division of Academia Sinica handles technical transfer cases when the original creator’s representative no longer works at Academia Sinica.

contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, the creative representative of the technology transfer must be a working researcher at Academia Sinica. Only in this way can the distribution of result income and technical consulting matters be handled.

title: The Intellectual Property Division of Academia Sinica handles technical transfer cases when the original creator’s representative no longer works at Academia Sinica.

contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If the original creator’s representative is no longer in Academia Sinica, we can find the next person to take over according to the list of creators in the original technical document. If necessary, you can also choose other creators within Academia Sinica to become new creative representatives. They will need to sign a licensing agreement. If we can't find any original creator to serve as the new creative representative, then we can ask the original creator to choose the most suitable person from Academia Sinica. If you really can't contact anyone, you can ask the head of the unit where the technical transfer case is located to select the most suitable person.

question: What authority and responsibilities does the project manager have?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The project manager has the right to add new technologies, patents and contracts, and can read all technology and patent information, but can only change the technology and patent information managed by his own account. He can also read the contract information he manages, but can only change the unlocked contract information. If the contract is confirmed, the project manager can apply for unlocking and then modify it. At the same time, he is also responsible for entering the contract payment records managed by his own account, and is also responsible for collecting the performance payments of the contract.

title: Essentials of Intellectual Property Database Management for Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Offices
question: Who are the audit supervisors of the IP database and what are their responsibilities?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The review supervisor of the intellectual property database confirms and locks the contract and collection information completed by the project manager. They want to ensure the accuracy of the information. If there are changes in the relevant contracts or other approved modifications, they will first unlock the data, let the project manager modify and reconfirm the modifications, and then lock the data.

title: Essentials of Intellectual Property Database Management for Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Offices
question: What is the role of project managers in the IP database and what operations can they do?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The project manager is mainly responsible for creating files of contract and payment information in the intellectual property database. After creation, this information will be confirmed and locked by the review supervisor. If there is a need for modification, such as an addition to the contract or an approved reason for modification, the project manager needs to apply for modification in the system by submitting the relevant official approval documents. Once the review supervisor has unlocked the information, the project manager can make changes. After the modification is completed, the review supervisor will confirm the modified content and then lock the data. So overall, the project manager is like a file maintainer here.

title: Essentials of Intellectual Property Database Management for Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Offices
question: If there are additional amendments or approved reasons for modification to the contract, what is the process for the IP database?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If the contract requires additions or approved modifications, the person in charge must first obtain the relevant approval documents and submit an application for data modification through the intellectual property database system. After the review supervisor sees the application, he will unlock the data and give the project manager the opportunity to modify the data. After the modification is completed, the review supervisor will confirm the modification again, and if there are no problems, the data will be locked again.

title: Essentials of Intellectual Property Database Management for Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Offices
question: How to submit an application for data modification through the IP database system?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: To submit an application for data modification through the intellectual property database system, the person in charge must first have relevant approval documents. Then submit an application to modify the information in the system. Then after the review supervisor unlocks it, the project manager can modify the data. After the final review supervisor confirms the modified content, the data will be locked again.

title: Essentials of Intellectual Property Database Management for Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Offices
question: How does the review supervisor confirm the modified content and lock the information?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: After the project manager submits a data modification application and completes the data modification process, the review supervisor needs to confirm the content of these new data. After confirmation, he will lock the modified data in the system.

There are two ways to recognize receivables for R&D achievements of Academia Sinica. The first is that if the contract clearly states the amount to be collected within a specific date, such as an upfront authorization fee, a material transfer fee, or a copyright fee for a work, etc., then the receivables will be recognized directly.

The second situation is that if the contract does not specify the amount of money to be collected on a specific date, but says that the income will depend on the development of the technology or product to a certain stage, or the actual sale of the product, then this situation will initially No receivables will be recognized. However, once the above conditions are met, such as development reaching a specific stage, or the product being sold, receivables will be recognized, including periodic authorization fees, royalties, etc.

title: Procedures for handling science and technology research and development procurement at the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office
question: What are the procedures for procurement cases where the patent application service fee is estimated to be less than 300,000 yuan?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: For patent application procurement cases with an estimated value of less than 300,000 yuan, the process is roughly as follows: the requisitioner fills out the patent application decision form, including the patent name, regulation number, etc., and then transfers it to the procurement personnel after approval by the director. Then the purchasing staff will search for market prices, fill in the expected purchasing scope, estimated budget and other information into the patent application purchase order, and conduct an internal feasibility review. Everyone in the department can see the case. If no one complains within three days, it will be passed. Once approved, the purchasing staff will invite the recommended firms to provide quotes. At this time, if the firm's price does not exceed the estimated budget, the firm will win the bid. Then, the purchasing staff will submit the procurement scope, object, price and other information together with the firm's official quotation to the director for approval. Finally, the purchasing staff will go to the firm to finalize the details.

title: Procedures for handling science and technology research and development procurement at the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office
question: What should be done if there is any objection?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If there are any objections, they must reply to the procurement staff via E-MAIL within three days, and then a procurement review team meeting will be held to discuss the issue.

title: Procedures for handling science and technology research and development procurement at the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office
question: What are the different procedures for procurement cases where the patent application service fee is estimated to be between 300,000 yuan and 1 million yuan?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The procurement process for a patent application service fee estimated to be between 300,000 yuan and 1 million yuan is just like any other. First, the requisitioner fills in the patent application form, including: patent name, serial number, creator, affiliation Unit, technical field and country to be applied for, etc., and then submit to the Director for approval. One thing that is different is that a procurement review team meeting needs to be planned. During the meeting, the procurement personnel will fill in the patent application procurement case review record form, including: patent name, serial number, application country, procurement case number, procurement scope, technical field, other characteristics, recommended firm, reasons and recommended budget, etc. After the meeting, the purchase case and review records must be sent to the Accounting Office together, and the purchase can only be processed after being verified by the Secretary-General. Next, the purchasing staff will propose a recommended base price based on market conditions and inquiry results, and then sign for approval by the director. After that, the bid will be opened. If it is a domestic firm, the firm will go to Academia Sinica to open the bid. If it is a foreign firm, it will be negotiated through communication. Finally, the purchasing personnel must verify the procurement results, bid opening records, reserve prices, quotations, etc. with Secretary Chen Feng. After obtaining approval, the purchasing personnel will handle the matter of appointing the firm. This is the procurement process for patent applications in this amount range.

If it is a foreign firm, the bid opening process will be conducted through communication negotiation. No matter which method is used, after the bid opening is completed, the bid opening record needs to be completed.

title: Procedures for handling science and technology research and development procurement at the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office
question: . What are the ways to ensure procurement quality?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The main way to ensure procurement quality is to set up a procurement review team to review all procurement-related matters, including specifications of purchased products, procurement methods, budget amounts, etc. If a group member proposes a procurement case, he needs to abstain from the meeting while reviewing the case and only play the role of taking minutes of the meeting. During the review process, if any colleagues have objections to the procurement case, the procurement staff will be notified via email within three days, and a procurement review team meeting will be held to discuss the matter. If no objections are received within three days, the purchase case will automatically be approved. When making large purchases, factors such as the firm's size, experience, goodwill, service quality, functionality, and price will be taken into consideration to ensure the quality of the purchase.

title: Procedures for handling science and technology research and development procurement at the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office
question: How does the science and technology research and development procurement operation procedure of the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office operate?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer:
The procurement procedure for scientific and technological research and development is as follows. First of all, it is applicable to procurement cases where the estimated patent application service fee is less than 300,000 yuan. Then let’s explain the detailed process. First, the requisitioner fills in the patent application decision form, including the patent’s name, serial number, author, unit, technical field, etc. After approval by the director, it is handed over to the purchaser. personnel to proceed with the next step of purchasing.

After confirming the market price, the purchasing staff will fill in the patent application purchase form, including the name of the patent application, the country of application, etc., and then conduct an internal content check. The procedures include setting up a file on the office's hard drive, purchasing personnel uploading information about the procurement case, and notifying colleagues in the general office for review. If there are any objections, they will be reported back to the procurement staff via email within three days for discussion by the procurement review team. If there are no objections, it will be deemed approved after three days.

In this way, after the procurement case is approved by the division's internal review and approved by the division director, the procurement staff will invite the proposed firm to make a formal quotation. If the quotation is within the budget, the firm will win the bid. Then the procurement results, including the scope, object, price and the firm's official quotation, are submitted to the director for approval. After approval, the purchasing staff will proceed with the appointment of a firm. This is the complete purchasing process.

title: Procedures for handling science and technology research and development procurement at the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office

Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw

First select the purchase case that applies to us, mainly the one with the estimated service fee being less than 300,000 yuan. Then ask the requisitioning personnel to fill in an intellectual property technology transfer patent application decision form, which contains some detailed information about the patent application, such as the name of the patent application, serial number, creator representative, affiliation, technical field and plan. Country of application etc. After filling it out, you can ask the director for approval. After approval, we can let the purchasing staff make the purchase. At this step, the purchasing staff will first inquire about the market price, and then fill in the patent application purchase form, including the patent name, application country, purchase case number, purchase scope, recommended firm, reasons, estimated budget, etc., all of the above are completed After that, the investigation process can be carried out.

The "Intellectual Finance and Technology Transfer Patent Application Decision Form" is filled out by the requisitioning personnel. As for the "Intellectual Finance Technology Transfer Patent Application Purchase Form", it is filled out by the purchasing staff after inquiring about the market price. It will include the name of the patent application, the country of application, procurement case number, scope of procurement, recommended firm, reasons and estimated budget amount, etc. After filling in, you will need to go through the content checking process within the office.

title: Procedures for handling science and technology research and development procurement at the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office
question: How is the process of handling science and technology research and development procurement carried out by the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office?

Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554

answer:
This procurement process is mainly for cases where the patent application service fee is estimated to be between 300,000 and 1 million yuan. In the initial stage, the requisitioning personnel fills out the decision form and it is approved by the director. The procurement review team will then review the patent application and fill out the review record form. The results of the procurement case will then be sent to the accounting office, and the procurement can be carried out after the Secretary-General’s approval.

The procurement staff will first consider the market conditions and inquiry results to make recommendations on the proposed base price, and the director will need to first approve the bargaining base price. The bid opening meeting will be conducted physically at Academia Sinica or negotiated via communication, depending on the location of the office, after which the bid opening record can be completed.

Finally, the procurement personnel attach the procurement results, including procurement objects, procurement scope, final bid prices and other relevant information, as well as bid opening records, reserve price lists, quotations, etc., and send them to the Secretary-General for review. Once approval is obtained, the purchasing staff can begin processing the appointment of the firm.

title: Procedures for handling science and technology research and development procurement at the Intellectual Property and Technology Transfer Office
question: I would like to ask, if you apply for a patent with an estimated amount of more than 1 million yuan but not more than 6 million yuan, what process is required?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer:
If the estimated amount of the patent application exceeds 1 million yuan but does not exceed 6 million yuan, the requisitioner will first fill in the patent application decision form, including the patent application name, serial number, creator representative and other detailed information. After approval by the director, it will be handed over to the purchasing staff for procurement.

Afterwards, the procurement staff will fill in the patent procurement case review record form and hold a procurement review team meeting. During the review process, factors such as the firm's size, experience, brand, service quality, functionality, and price should be evaluated, and the review results should be recorded and archived for future reference.

Then, the procurement case and the review record are sent to the accounting office, and the procurement can be started after the Secretary-General’s approval.

The purchasing staff then sets a base price based on market conditions and inquiry results, and asks the Secretary-General to approve it before negotiating.

The method of handling the bid opening meeting depends on the location of the firm. If it is a domestic firm, the firm will come to Academia Sinica to open the bid; if it is a foreign firm, the price will be negotiated through communication.

Once the bid opening is complete, record it. Then, the procurement personnel will submit the results of the procurement, such as the procurement object, scope and determined price, as well as the procurement signature, bid opening record, bottom price list and quotation to the Secretary-General for approval.

Finally, once approved, the procurement officer will process the appointment of the firm.

title: Things to note when setting up a new start-up company when Academia Sinica handles value creation projects
question: What matters need to be paid attention to when Academia Sinica handles price creation plans to establish new companies?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: In addition to allocating the equity of the price innovation team in accordance with the regulations of the Ministry of Science and Technology, it is also important to note that Academia Sinica also has equity income, which includes the equity and cash obtained. The distribution method is as follows. If there is an equity transfer that requires the payment of supplementary premiums for health insurance, Academia Sinica will use its equity income to pay. If there is a grant or phased grant, it should be distributed to the treasury or funding agency. After deducting the administrative costs, the rest will be given to Academia Sinica and will not be distributed to the creators or their units or laboratories. . As for the royalties or sublicensing fees, after deducting the portion to be distributed to the treasury or funding agencies, they will be distributed to the creator, the creator's unit and laboratory in accordance with the regulations of Academia Sinica. However, if the rights and interests that the creator has received from the regulations of the Ministry of Science and Technology exceed the distribution amount stipulated by Academia Sinica, the rights and interests income of the relicensing fee can no longer be allocated, and half of the original distribution amount will be allocated to the creator's unit and experiment in equal proportions. room. Finally, if the creator's unit and laboratory receives an allocation, administrative costs are deducted before the remainder is calculated.

title: Things to note when setting up a new start-up company when Academia Sinica handles value creation projects
question: How is the equity income from the Value Creation Project distributed?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer:
The equity income distribution of Academia Sinica’s price creation project has the following situations. First of all, the equity is transferred due to the price creation plan, and the resulting health insurance supplementary insurance premiums will be paid by Academia Sinica, unless the contract of the price creation plan has other provisions.

In the case of authorization funds and stage authorization funds, after deducting the proportion payable to the treasury or target agency and related administrative costs, all the remaining portion of the equity income belongs to Academia Sinica. Except for the above circumstances, the equity income will no longer be distributed to the creators and their units or laboratories.

However, if it is a royalty or sublicensing fee, after part of it is allocated to the national treasury or the target agency, the remaining part will be distributed to the creator, the creator's unit, and the company based on the scope and usage of Academia Sinica's R&D results. laboratory. If the value of the rights and interests that the creator has obtained in accordance with the relevant provisions of the Ministry of Science and Technology’s Price Creation Plan exceeds the amount that can be distributed, then he will no longer be able to obtain the rights and interests of the relicensing fee, and half of the rights and interests he could have originally received will be distributed proportionally to his company. Solanum units and laboratories.

Finally, for the units and laboratories to which the creator belongs, the allocated portion should be deducted from their share of administrative costs.

title: Things to note when setting up a new start-up company when Academia Sinica handles value creation projects
question: Who pays the supplementary insurance premiums for health insurance?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The supplementary insurance premium for health insurance is borne by Academia Sinica.

title: Things to note when setting up a new start-up company when Academia Sinica handles value creation projects
question: How is the income from authorization fees and stage authorization fees handled?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: After deducting the proportion and related administrative costs that should be allocated to the treasury or funding agencies, the remaining income from authorization funds and stage authorization funds will belong to Academia Sinica. Unless there are special circumstances, it will generally not be reassigned to the creators or their units and laboratories.

title: Things to note when setting up a new start-up company when Academia Sinica handles value creation projects
question: If it is revenue from royalties or sublicenses, how will they be allocated?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Income from royalties or sublicensing fees will first be allocated to the treasury or funding agency, and then to the creator, the unit and laboratory to which the creator belongs, in accordance with the regulations on the ownership and use of R&D results of Academia Sinica. The remaining money will be given to Academia Sinica. However, if the value of the rights and interests that the creator has obtained in accordance with the provisions of the Ministry of Science and Technology’s Value Creation Plan exceeds the scope allowed by the regulations on the ownership and use of research and development results of Academia Sinica, then he will no longer be able to receive the income from the relicensing fee that should have been given to him Half will be reallocated to his units and labs. If the creator's unit or laboratory is allocated in accordance with regulations, they will have to deduct their share of administrative costs before they can get the remaining portion.

title: Things to note when setting up a new start-up company when Academia Sinica handles value creation projects
question: What role does the unit and laboratory to which the creator belongs play in income distribution?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The unit and laboratory to which the creator belongs plays an important role in income distribution. When the supplementary health insurance premiums derived from the equity transfer of Academia Sinica’s valuable creation project are incurred, the relevant expenses will be borne by Academia Sinica’s equity income paid to the creator’s affiliated units and laboratories. In addition, if there is any income from royalties or sublicensing fees, after deducting the portion that should be transferred to the national treasury or funding agencies, it can be distributed to the creator, the creator's unit and laboratory in accordance with the regulations of Academia Sinica. However, if the creator has exceeded a certain amount of distribution, he can no longer participate in the income distribution of the relicensing fee. Half of the original share will be distributed to the creator's unit and laboratory in equal proportions. Finally, after receiving the allocation, the units and laboratories to which the creator belongs must deduct their share of administrative costs.

title: Things to note when setting up a new start-up company when Academia Sinica handles value creation projects
question: If the creators have already received benefits through the Ministry of Science and Technology’s Price Innovation Program, can they still participate in the distribution of equity income from sublicensing fees?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If the rights received by creators through the Ministry of Science and Technology’s Value Creation Program exceed the amount that can be distributed under Article 7, Paragraph 2, Paragraph 1 of the Measures for the Attribution and Utilization of R&D Achievements of Academia Sinica, they will no longer be able to participate in the rights income from sublicensing fees. Assigned.

title: Things to note when setting up a new start-up company when Academia Sinica handles value creation projects
question: How are the administrative costs associated with distribution handled by the author's unit and laboratory?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: When the creator's unit and laboratory distributes equity income, they need to deduct the administrative costs they should bear first, and the rest is the equity income they can receive.
