Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Academia Sinica's acceptance of funded research projects means that Academia Sinica will accept support from individuals, organizations, schools or government departments outside the academy, including research funds, skills, materials, equipment, manpower or intellectual property, etc., so that researchers at Academia Sinica can carry out specific research plan.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Where do the resources for funding research projects come from?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Resources for funding research projects come from outside individuals, institutions, schools or government agencies. They provide research funding, technology, materials, equipment, personnel or intellectual property to allow Academia Sinica researchers to carry out research projects.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: What is the role of Academia Sinica researchers in this project?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The role of researchers at Academia Sinica is to conduct research projects funded by outside institutions. They use research funding, technology, materials, equipment, personnel, or intellectual property from individuals, institutions, schools, or government agencies to develop specific research results.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: What does the form of funding include?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The main forms of funding include providing research funds, providing technology, providing materials and equipment, providing researchers, and providing intellectual property.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Are there any special regulations applicable to the implementation of the Academia Sinica’s work points for funded research projects or research projects funded by domestic government agencies?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: No, in fact, this operating point for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects does not apply to the implementation of the institute’s public budget research projects or research projects funded by domestic government agencies.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If researchers at Academia Sinica are implementing a research project funded by a government agency in their home country, do they still need to comply with these key points for accepting funded research projects?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: No, if their projects are funded by government agencies in their home countries, they do not need to comply with Academia Sinica’s guidelines for accepting funded research projects.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: This is the key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects. Are there any special regulations for research projects conducted by Academia Sinica’s researchers?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: For in-house public budget research projects conducted by Academia Sinica researchers or research projects funded by national government agencies, the operating points for Academia Sinica's funded research projects do not apply.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If the research project implemented by Academia Sinica researchers is funded by a subsidy budget prepared by a government agency, do they still need to follow the operating points for accepting funded research projects?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: No, if Academia Sinica’s research projects are supported by subsidy budgets prepared by government agencies, they do not need to follow the operating points for accepting funded research projects.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: When researchers from Academia Sinica participate in funded research projects, will their work and academic research autonomy be affected?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: No, when Academia Sinica researchers participate in funded research projects, they must not let it affect their own work and academic research autonomy. They also need to pursue excellence in research.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Do Academia Sinica researchers who participate in funded research projects need to pursue excellence in research?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, Academia Sinica researchers participating in funded research projects are required to pursue research excellence.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: What procedures are required before participating in Academia Sinica's funded research projects?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Before participating in a research project funded by Academia Sinica, it first needs to be reviewed by the relevant institute or research center. After review, it will be further reported to Academia Sinica for approval of the funded research contract. Then the process of making an offer or expressing a commitment in the name of Academia Sinica and completing the signing of the contract is completed. If researchers at Academia Sinica conduct a collaborative research project with an external research institution, and if the research project is funded in the name of an external research institution, the research plan needs to be proposed and finalized before being submitted to the research institute or research institute. Center, and then further send it to the Academia Sinica for review.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If a researcher receives funding in the name of a research institution other than Academia Sinica, is there anything else that needs to be done?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If researchers receive funding in the name of other research institutions other than Academia Sinica, they need to report this situation to their institute or research center after the research plan is submitted and finalized, and then send it to Academia Sinica for record.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: What will be the consequences if researchers at Academia Sinica fail to sign a research funding contract in accordance with the prescribed procedures?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If researchers at Academia Sinica fail to sign a funded research contract in accordance with the prescribed procedures, Academia Sinica has the right to demand from them the management fees that should be paid. Moreover, if this results in other losses, Academia Sinica can also require them to compensate for these losses.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: What factors does Academia Sinica need to consider when reviewing funded research projects?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Academia Sinica generally considers four factors when reviewing funded research projects. First of all, it depends on whether the research plan is consistent with the academic development goals or tasks of Academia Sinica and the center. Next, it depends on whether the research design and the achievement of the project goals are scientific and reasonable. Then, it is necessary to evaluate whether the funding for the research project and the amount of time, intelligence, manpower and material resources Academia Sinica will spend to achieve the project goals are reasonable. Finally, it is necessary to evaluate how much intellectual effort is invested in the funding source of the funded research project and the proportion of it, and whether there are any special circumstances in the funded research project. However, if researchers from Academia Sinica participate in research projects of foreign governments or non-profit institutions recognized by Academia Sinica, and the funding conditions are that the research design and project goals must be scientific and reasonable, there is no need to review the second point above.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Does the research project need to comply with the academic development goals or tasks of Academia Sinica and the center?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, the research plan needs to be consistent with the academic development goals or tasks of Academia Sinica and the center.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Will Academia Sinica consider the scientific rationality of the research project and the reasonable use of funds?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, Academia Sinica will consider the scientific rationality of the research plan and the reasonable use of funds when reviewing the research plan. They will look at whether the plan is consistent with Academia Sinica's academic development goals, and will also review funding sources and whether there are special circumstances in the research plan. However, if Academia Sinica researchers participate in a research plan funded by a foreign government or non-profit organization recognized by Academia Sinica, and the funding source has confirmed the scientific rationality of the research plan, then there is no need to review this part.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If the research project is funded by a foreign government agency or non-profit organization, does it need to be reviewed by Academia Sinica?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If the research project is funded by a foreign government agency or non-profit organization, and the funding conditions they adopt are scientifically reasonable, then the research project does not need to be reviewed by Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If funding provided by foreign government agencies or non-profit institutions is a research project based on scientific rationality, does it still need to be reviewed by Academia Sinica?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If foreign government agencies or non-profit institutions provide funding for research projects based on scientific rationality, they do not need to be reviewed by Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If my research plan is not consistent with the academic development goals of Academia Sinica, will it affect the approval of the review?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If your research plan is inconsistent with the academic development goals of Academia Sinica, it will not pass the review. If you start implementing such a plan, you will also be asked to terminate it.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If my research has a negative impact on my job, will I be asked to terminate it?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if your research has a negative impact on your job, Academia Sinica will indeed request that the research be terminated.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Assuming that my research may damage the image of Academia Sinica, will people refuse to allow me to conduct it?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if your research may damage the image of Academia Sinica, according to regulations, you may not be allowed to start it.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If there is a possibility of leaking official secrets during research, will he be shot directly?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if the research is likely to leak official secrets, it will not pass the review directly, and if it has already started, it will also be asked to terminate.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If the research I am conducting has suspicions of fraud, will it be stopped immediately?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, as long as your research has suspicions of malpractice, it will be stopped immediately.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Will research that violates academic ethics be immediately suspended?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if the research violates academic ethics, Academia Sinica will immediately terminate the research project.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If the research threatens to infringe on academic autonomy or independence, will this make it impossible to proceed with the project?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if the research might infringe on academic autonomy or independence, this would make it impossible to proceed.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If the research leads to the leakage of the country's core key technologies, will it be directly banned?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if the research may lead to the leakage of the country's core key technologies, this situation will be directly prohibited.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If there are concerns about endangering the safety or health of personnel, will the research be terminated immediately?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Research does end immediately if it threatens the safety or health of personnel.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: . If I may improperly spend public funds or use public property of Academia Sinica, will it be serious enough that someone will ask me to terminate my plan?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if your behavior may involve improper expenditure of public funds or use of public property of Academia Sinica, if the situation is serious, you may indeed be required to terminate your research project.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If our research project is funded by Academia Sinica, who will own the newly developed intellectual property rights?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Intellectual property rights for newly developed research and development will usually belong to Academia Sinica. But if the source of your funding also makes substantial intellectual contributions, then it can be jointly owned in proportion to the contribution. In addition, in some specific cases, for example, if the project is to implement public policy, or to provide scarce technical services, or to use existing technology to produce customized results, then the intellectual property rights can all belong to the source of funding. . As for the detailed regulations and conditions, it may depend on the agreement between Academia Sinica and the sponsor.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If our research project is funded by a government agency, do all intellectual property rights belong to us?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If your research project is funded by a government agency, you can actually agree with them that all intellectual property rights belong to the funding source, which is the government agency. But the point is, this must be consistent with the purpose of public policy.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If we and Academia Sinica accept funding from foreign non-profit institutions, how will Academia Sinica handle issues related to intellectual property rights?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If we and Academia Sinica receive funding from foreign non-profit institutions, the treatment of intellectual property rights will be determined based on the specific research plan. If the research project is to be used for public welfare purposes, or the funding source or leading party coordinates the use of the research results, then the intellectual property rights may all belong to the funding source or a third party. However, Academia Sinica can also enjoy equity income from research results based on its contribution ratio. Therefore, the specific handling method depends on the details of the research plan.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: During the experiment, if we provide special technical services, will all intellectual property rights belong to us?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if special technical services are provided during the experiment, the intellectual property rights can all belong to the party providing the services.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If our research project uses existing technology to produce customized results for funding sources, who will own the intellectual property rights to these results?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If your research project uses existing technology to produce customized results, the intellectual property rights to these new results will vest entirely with the funding source.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If our research results belong to Academia Sinica, what kind of rights can we get?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If your research results belong to Academia Sinica, you can enjoy some specific rights and interests. First of all, you can enjoy non-exclusive non-commercial use authorization in advance under certain conditions. This means that even if the results belong to Academia Sinica, you can also use these research results in non-commercial circumstances. Secondly, when the research results are completed, you have the priority to enter licensing negotiations, which means that you have priority to negotiate how to use the research results. Finally, if Academia Sinica obtains income from authorizing this research result, you can enjoy the right to distribute the benefits according to the proportion of your contribution. This means that if Academia Sinica makes money from this research result, you can get part of it.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: When we are doing research projects sponsored by Academia Sinica, how should we allocate funding sources according to actual R&D costs?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer:
When you are doing research projects sponsored by Academia Sinica, the allocation of research funds needs to be based on actual R&D costs. This includes the following costs that can be directly used for research and development:

First of all, personnel expenses should include the salary of the project execution staff, the research hosting fee, and 25% of the salary or scholarship of the contracted personnel if they participate in the project without affecting their own work.

Next, business expenses include equipment use and maintenance, materials, printing, attendance, review fees, and more.

Next is the equipment fee.

Finally, relevant taxes and government fees must be included.

It should be noted that all these fees must be handled in accordance with the standards of the Executive Yuan or the relevant procedures of the Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: How should the personnel expenses of personnel hired specifically for plan execution be included in the personnel expenses?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The employment expenses in personnel expenses are mainly the expenses for the personnel specially recruited to implement the plan. This part of the funding should be allocated based on their actual research and development costs. Of course, all this arrangement must be carried out in accordance with the standards of the Executive Yuan or the relevant procedures of the Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: How are research hosting fees calculated?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The research chair fee is a research project resource used to pay the research chairperson who executes the project. This fee is based on the actual costs of the research and funding sources.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: How should the expenses for postdoctoral research scholars, assistants and scholarship students participating in the project be calculated?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If postdoctoral research scholars, assistants and scholarship students participate in research projects without affecting their regular work, their payments may be listed in the research project funding. But each person’s monthly payment cannot exceed 25% of their salary or scholarship. And each person's total monthly program execution fee cannot exceed their salary or scholarship. These costs can only be included in research project funds funded by national government agencies, public schools, administrative corporations, or government-contributed corporate entities, and must be provided in accordance with procurement procedures.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If it is a research project funded by a government agency or public school, what regulations need to be followed to prepare project funds?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If it is a research project funded by a government agency or public school, their resources must be used in accordance with the procurement procedures before this funding source can be used. Of course, all fees should be handled in accordance with the standards of the Executive Yuan or the relevant procedures of the Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: What expenses do business expenses include, and how are they compiled?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Business expenses include equipment use and maintenance fees, material fees, printing fees, attendance fees, review fees, travel expenses, etc. These expenses are directly used for research and development. As for how to compile it, it is done according to the standards of the Executive Yuan or the relevant procedures of the Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: How should equipment fees be compiled?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: For the equipment fee, you need to budget it based on the actual research and development costs. And it must be handled uniformly in accordance with the standards of the Executive Yuan or the relevant procedures of the Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Do relevant taxes and other derivative government fees also need to be included in the calculation?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, these related taxes and other derivative government fees also need to be included in the calculation.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Finally, what standards or procedures should be followed for handling the above fees?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The above fees should be handled in accordance with the standards of the Executive Yuan or the relevant procedures of the Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If the research project I proposed is funded by the government or a school, what percentage of the total funding should the administrative expenses account for?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If your research project is funded by the government or school, unless otherwise agreed by Academia Sinica, administrative expenses will usually account for 15% of the total funding.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If the funding source is not from the government or the school, what percentage of funds should I set aside for administrative expenses?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If the funding source is not the government or school, you need to set aside 20% of the funding for administrative expenses.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Unless Academia Sinica agrees, is there a fixed percentage of administrative fees for each funded research project?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, if the source of funding is a government agency, school or non-profit organization in the country, the administrative fee is usually calculated as 15% of the total research funding. If funding comes from other sources, the management fee needs to be calculated as 20% of the total research funding. Unless Academia Sinica has given consent, this rule must be followed.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If the source of funds is a government agency or a public school, if they have special regulations, do I still need to prepare management fees according to the 15% regulation?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If government agencies or public schools have special regulations, it is not necessary to compile management fees according to the 15% regulation, and it is still OK.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: How is the allocation method of management fees determined?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: The distribution method of management fees is mostly one-third to Academia Sinica and two-thirds to the plan implementation unit, except for the specially stipulated parts. Academia Sinica will separately decide how to allocate the management fees for the research projects jointly implemented by the Biomedical Translation Research Center and the employer. In addition, 5% of the management fees received by each project execution unit of the Life Group will be given to the Life Sciences Library.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If it is a research project jointly employed by the Biomedical Translation Research Center and the main employing unit, how is the management fee allocated?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If it is a research project jointly conducted by the joint staff of the Biomedical Translation Research Center and the main employing unit, the allocation method of the management fee will be determined by Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Must 5% of the management fee received by each project execution unit of the Life Group be allocated to the Life Sciences Library?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, five percent of the administrative fees earned by each program execution unit in the Life Group must be allocated to the Life Sciences Library.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: How should the management fees be used in accordance with the fourth point in the handling of management fees for commissioned and subsidized research projects by Academia Sinica?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: That is to say, we must follow the regulations of Academia Sinica. Their fourth bullet point clearly explains how the management fee is used. We just need to manage the management fees strictly according to that.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Article 12 of the key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects is related to management fees, right?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, you are right. Academia Sinica accepts commissioned and funded research projects, and their management fees must be implemented in accordance with the provisions of Article 4 of the Operating Points.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Is it necessary to comply with the fourth point on the handling of management fees for commissioned and subsidized research projects by Academia Sinica when using management fees?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, it is necessary to comply with the fourth point of the Academia Sinica’s regulations on the handling of management fees for commissioned and subsidized research projects.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: Academia Sinica has received instructions on the key points of funded research projects. Do we need to use management fees in accordance with the regulations there?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, we need to use the management fee in accordance with the operating points of the funded research projects of Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: The deposit or earnest money cannot be paid with public funds, right?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: That’s right, the deposit or earnest money cannot be paid with public funds.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If the research contract requires a deposit or security deposit, I can't pay it with public funds, right?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Yes, you can't pay with public funds.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If my research project involves human trials or the use of human specimens, how far in advance do I need to submit the relevant information to the Academia Sinica committee for review?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If your research plan involves human trials or the use of human specimens, you need to submit relevant information to the Academia Sinica committee for review before signing the research contract.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If I conduct experiments on infectious biological materials or genetic recombination, what procedures do I need to follow to submit relevant materials?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If you want to conduct experiments on infectious biological materials or genetic recombination, then before signing the research contract, you must submit the relevant information to the relevant review committee for review according to the regulations of Academia Sinica.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: What kind of information needs to be submitted to the relevant committees of Academia Sinica for review before signing a research contract?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: Before the research contract is signed, if the research involves human experiments, the use of human specimens, human embryos, human embryonic stem cells, or related experiments such as infectious biological material experiments, genetic recombination, gene transfection field experiments, and animal experiments, it needs to be based on According to the regulations of Academia Sinica, relevant materials will be submitted to the relevant committees of Academia Sinica for review.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: How do I recruit personnel, spend funds and write off expenses?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: You need to recruit personnel, spend funds, and write off expenses according to the signed contract and relevant laws and regulations.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: In the process of executing a research plan, how should we comply with the contract and relevant laws and regulations?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: When executing a research plan, selecting personnel, spending funds, and writing off the process, all must follow the contract and relevant regulations.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If Academia Sinica researchers do not use any Academia Sinica resources to conduct externally funded research projects, what regulations do they need to comply with?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If researchers at Academia Sinica do not use any resources from Academia Sinica to conduct research projects funded by outside institutions, they still have to follow the part-time regulations. In addition, when they start doing research projects, if there are situations listed in point 7 1, then the research must be carried out in accordance with the requirements of point 7.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: What to do if the implementation of the research plan encounters the situation in point 7?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer: If the situation in point 7 collides with the situation during the execution of the research, then the research project must be stopped in accordance with the provisions of point 7.

title: Key points for Academia Sinica’s funded research projects
question: If researchers at Academia Sinica want to receive funding from external research institutions and use Academia Sinica resources to conduct research, what regulations need to be followed?
contact:
Intellectual Property Division, Academia Sinica
2787-2554
ip@gate.sinica.edu.tw
answer:
If researchers at Academia Sinica want to use Academia Sinica's resources and receive funding from external research institutions to conduct research, they need to comply with the following regulations:

If they do not use other resources of Academia Sinica to participate in research projects funded by outside the institute, unless they comply with the part-time regulations, they will use the provisions of point 4 when executing the research projects. If they begin any research project and fall into any of the situations listed in point 7, the termination provisions of point 7 will apply.

In addition, if they use Academia Sinica's resources to collaborate with an outside research institution to execute a research plan, and then receive funding in the name of the outside research institution, their execution of the research plan will be the same as above.
